trans-unit.source: Provides a base class that exposes an element to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)].

When [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] queries the root of a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] application about an element, the root returns the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peer for that element.
The peer also responds to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] queries about its corresponding element.
Provides initialization for base class values when they are called by the constructor of a derived class.

Gets or sets an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> that is reported to the automation client as a source for all the events that come from this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> that is the source of events.
Gets the accelerator key combinations for the element that is associated with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peer.
The accelerator key.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey*>.
If an application responds to keyboard events to provide shortcut key behavior, it should return a string that contains the keyboard shortcut combination.
For example, for an element that can copy text to the clipboard, this attached property might be set to the value "CTRL+C".
The accelerator key.
Gets the access key for the element that is associated with the automation peer.
The string that contains the access key.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey*>.

An access key (sometimes referred to as a keyboard shortcut or mnemonic) is a character in the text of a menu, menu item, or label of a control such as a button that invokes the associated menu function.
For example, to provide a shortcut way to open the `File` menu (for which the access key is typically F), an element might have this attached property set to "ALT+F".
The string that contains the access key.
Gets the control type for the element that is associated with the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peer.
The control type.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType*>.
The control type.
Gets the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId*> of the element that is associated with the automation peer.
The value of the automation identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property.
If that property is not set, the value is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.
The identifier.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId*>.
The value of the automation identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property.
If that property is not set, the value is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.
The string that contains the identifier.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> object that represents the screen coordinates of the element that is associated with the automation peer.
The bounding rectangle.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle*>.
The bounding rectangle.
Gets the collection of GetChildren elements that are represented in the UI Automation tree as immediate child elements of the automation peer.
The collection of child elements.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren*>.
The collection of child elements.

Gets a name that is used with <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType"></xref>, to differentiate the control that is represented by this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref>.
The class name.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName*>.
The class name.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> on the element that is associated with the automation peer that responds to a mouse click.

For example, if the element represents a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>, a clickable point is any point in the visible client area of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> that issues the command that the button represents when it is clicked by the mouse.
A point in the clickable area of the element.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint*>.
A point within the clickable area of the element.
Gets text that describes the functionality of the control that is associated with the automation peer.
The returned string typically provides the same text that is provided by the tooltip for the control.
The help text.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText*>.
The help text.

Tells [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] where in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree to place the <xref uid="langword_csharp_hwnd" name="hwnd" href=""></xref> being hosted by a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] element.
This method returns the hosted `hwnd` to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] for controls that host `hwnd` objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> that is associated with an element that immediately hosts an `hwnd` must override this method.

If this method is not overridden, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] places the `hwnd` as a child element of the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> that hosts the whole application.

Typically, you want to override this default behavior and set [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] to position the hosted `hwnd` parallel to the place where it is located in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] logical tree.
Except in hosting scenarios, do not allow <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> types to override this method.

In addition to overriding this method, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> types that are associated with an element that immediately hosts an `hwnd` must return the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> that is cast to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple> in response to WM_GETOBJECT coming to the hosted `hwnd`.
To get a pointer to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple>, call <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.AutomationInteropProvider.HostProviderFromHandle%2A>.

This method returns the hosted <xref uid="langword_csharp_hwnd" name="hwnd" href=""></xref> to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] for controls that host <xref uid="langword_csharp_hwnd" name="hwnd" href=""></xref> objects.
Gets text that conveys the visual status of the element that is associated with this automation peer.
For example, the status of a messenger contact might be "Busy" or "Online".
The status.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus*>.
The status.
Gets a string that describes what kind of item an object represents.
Examples of the returned string are "Mail Message", "Contact", and "Document".
The kind of item.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType*>.
The kind of item.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Label"></xref> that is targeted to the element.

For example, if the element is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> control, the GetLabeledBy method gets the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> that is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.

In the following image, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> "Themes" is targeted to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>; therefore the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AccessText.AccessKey%2A> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> also targets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
When the user presses **ALT**+**T**, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> gets focus instead of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>.

![Display properties shows labeled by usage](~/add/media/labeledby.JPG "Display properties shows labeled by usage") The GetLabeledBy method for <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ComboBoxAutomationPeer> returns the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer> for the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>.
This enables an automation client to get the text string that describes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer"></xref> for the element that is targeted by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Label"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy*>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer"></xref> for the element that is targeted by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Label"></xref>.

Gets a human-readable localized string that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType"></xref> value for the control that is associated with this automation peer.
The type of the control.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLocalizedControlType*>.
The type of the control.
Gets text that describes the element that is associated with this automation peer.
This method calls the derived implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetNameCore%2A>.
The name.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName*>.
You can think of this value as a string that users use to explain the control they are referring to.
This property is used by tools such as Narrator to tell the user what the control is.
For example, a button with a string "OK" should return "OK".
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> control that lets users select a color might return "Colors".

Make sure that you have assigned a name to all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] so that accessibility tools such as screen readers can refer to each control in a localized manner.
The string that contains the label.
Gets a value that indicates the explicit control orientation, if any.
The orientation of the control.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation*>.
The orientation of the control.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> that is the parent of this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref>.
The parent automation peer.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the control pattern that is associated with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface"></xref>.
A value from the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface"></xref> enumeration.
The object that implements the pattern interface; <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if this peer does not support this interface.
Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> from the specified point.
The position on the screen to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> from.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> at the specified point.
When overridden in a derived class, is called from <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPeerFromPoint*>.
The position on the screen to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> from.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> at the specified point.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element that is associated with this automation peer currently has keyboard focus.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element has keyboard focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element has keyboard focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Triggers recalculation of the main properties of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> and raises the <xref:System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged> notification to the Automation Client if the properties changed.

Examples of main properties include, but are not limited to, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.LogicalChildren%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.BoundingRectangle%2A>.
Typically, updates and notifications happen automatically after the update of the layout in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].

(The update occurs in response to the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> event.) Sometimes, however, properties change without raising the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> event.
For example, when the whole <xref:System.Windows.Window> moves, the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LayoutUpdated> event is not raised.
In this example, the set of <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderFragment.BoundingRectangle%2A> objects change because the objects are expressed in screen coordinates.
Therefore, the <xref:System.Windows.Window> must call InvalidatePeer on its peer on <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.WindowAutomationPeer>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element that is associated with this automation peer contains data that is presented to the user.
A content element contains data that is presented to the user.
An example of a content element is an item in a list box or a button in a dialog box.
You typically use non-content elements (which are also referred to as peripheral elements) to work with the content in a composite control.
An example of a non-content element is the button in a drop-down control.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is a content element; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is a content element; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether the element is understood by the user as interactive or as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)].
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is a control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is a control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element associated with this automation peer supports interaction.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element supports interaction; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsEnabled*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the automation peer can receive and send events; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether the element that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> hosts <xref uid="langword_csharp_hwnds" name="hwnds" href=""></xref> in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].

Two examples of elements that host `hwnds` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] are <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup>.
These peers must also override <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHostRawElementProviderCore%2A>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> hosts <xref uid="langword_csharp_hwnds" name="hwnds" href=""></xref> in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element can accept keyboard focus.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element can accept keyboard focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element can accept keyboard focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether an element is off the screen.
This property does not indicate whether the element is visible.
In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible.
For example, if the element is on the screen but obscured by other elements, it might not be visible.
In this case, the method returns `false`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element contains sensitive content.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element contains sensitive content such as a password; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element contains sensitive content; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the element that is associated with this peer must be completed on a form.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element must be completed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm*>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is must be completed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] is listening for the specified event.
Typically, you call this method before creating the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> that raises the event.

This method is a performance measure because if [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] does not listen for the event, it does not make sense to create a peer to raise one.

> [!NOTE] > This method is static and only answers if a delegate listens for the specified event in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)], not for an event on a specific element.
[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] can create broadcast listeners; therefore the per-element information is irrelevant.
One of the enumeration values.

A <xref uid="langword_csharp_boolean" name="boolean" href=""></xref> that indicates whether [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] is listening for the event.
Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple"></xref> proxy.
The class that implements <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple"></xref> proxy.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref>.
The automation peer.
The proxy.
Called by the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> to raise the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.AsyncContentLoadedEvent"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises an automation event.
The event identifier.
Raises an event to notify the automation client of a changed property value.
The property that changed.
The previous value of the property.
The new value of the property.
Synchronously resets the tree of child elements by calling <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildrenCore*>.
Use this method in certain peer implementations that change the set of child elements in response to a call to a control pattern interface.
An example is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider>, which can change the child elements of the peer by moving the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextRange>.
Sets the keyboard focus on the element that is associated with this automation peer.
When overridden in a derived class, is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus*>.
